bill_title: authorize the Board of Regents to dispose of certain structures located at the Agricultural Experiment Station Beef Nutrition and Dairy Units in Brookings County, to construct cattle feed preparation and silage storage facilities at the Beef Nutrition Unit, and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Board of Regents to dispose of certain structures located at the Agricultural Experiment Station Beef Nutrition and Dairy Units in Brookings County, to construct cattle feed preparation and silage storage facilities at the Beef Nutrition Unit, and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Board of Regents may sell, exchange, or demolish building 1318, a metal- sided, single-storied building, and buildings 1310, 1311, 1312, 1317, and 1320, silos, all of which are located on the Agricultural Experiment Station Beef Nutrition Unit, in Brookings County. The Board of Regents may sell, exchange, or demolish building 1107 and 1108, silos, all of which are located on the Agricultural Experiment Station Dairy Unit, in Brookings County. Section 2. The Board of Regents may contract to replace building 1318 with an appropriate structure for preparation of cattle feeds and buildings 1310, 1311, 1312, 1317, and 1320 with four concrete bunker silos and concrete aprons on the Agricultural Experiment Station Beef Nutrition Unit, in Brookings County. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated one hundred thirty thousand dollars ($130,000) of other fund expenditure authority to South Dakota State University to accomplish the purposes of this Act. Section 4. Notwithstanding the provisions of § 13-51-14, the Board of Regents may accept, transfer, and expend any funds obtained for the purposes of this Act from federal sources, gifts, contributions, or any other sources, including any revenue derived from the sale of the buildings identified in section 1 of this Act. Section 5. The design and construction of the replacement building and silos shall be under the general charge and supervision of the Bureau of Administration as provided in chapter 5-14. The commissioner of the Bureau of Administration and the executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Board of Regents to dispose of certain structures located at the Agricultural Experiment Station Beef Nutrition and Dairy Units in Brookings County, to construct cattle feed preparation and silage storage facilities at the Beef Nutrition Unit, and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Board of Regents may sell, exchange, or demolish building 1318, a metal- sided, single-storied building, and buildings 1310, 1311, 1312, 1317, and 1320, silos, all of which are located on the Agricultural Experiment Station Beef Nutrition Unit, in Brookings County. The Board of Regents may sell, exchange, or demolish building 1107 and 1108, silos, all of which are located on the Agricultural Experiment Station Dairy Unit, in Brookings County. Section 2. The Board of Regents may contract to replace building 1318 with an appropriate structure for preparation of cattle feeds and buildings 1310, 1311, 1312, 1317, and 1320 with four concrete bunker silos and concrete aprons on the Agricultural Experiment Station Beef Nutrition Unit, in Brookings County. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated two hundred thousand dollars ($200,000) of other fund expenditure authority to South Dakota State University to accomplish the purposes of this Act. Section 4. Notwithstanding the provisions of § 13-51-14, the Board of Regents may accept, transfer, and expend any funds obtained for the purposes of this Act from federal sources, gifts, contributions, or any other sources, including any revenue derived from the sale of the buildings identified in section 1 of this Act. Section 5. The design and construction of the replacement building and silos shall be under the general charge and supervision of the Bureau of Administration as provided in chapter 5-14. The commissioner of the Bureau of Administration and the executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act.
